mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to William Pearce, 1793 October 27
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: George Washington has decided to engage superintendent of carpenters for another year--could not find anyone to replace-comments on man who looks after the house people, ditchers, etc.-after winter, Pearce can decide to remain at Mount Vernon or live elsewhere-construction of house for Mr. Crow-Negro children forbidden to enter the yards and gardens (excluding the children of cook and her husband the Mulatto Frank). Autograph letter signed, 4 pages, docketed.
